text:
I know you say it's your favorite soundtrack, but I personally find a lot of the tracks forgettable. I think CT and MMX beat it in terms of entire soundtracks. 

But when Earthbound has a good track, by god is it ever good.

author: xavier

text: Let's see... Chrono Trigger was released in 1995, but I feel like Supra's going to save it for #2000, so I'm guessing that Donkey Kong Country 2 will be his next upload. 1996 on the other hand is gonna be a tough one. Super Mario RPG, Super Mario 64, and Resident Evil all make for strong contenders, but I wouldn't put a surprise Nights into Dreams entry past him either... The suspense is killing me!
author: Michael Cockrum

text: I feel Supra decided to do these uploads on the year partly because #2000 will be a year 2000 release... that said, my money is on Deus Ex, Diablo 2, or Shenmue with outside chance of Vagrant Story, Wild Arms 2, Majora's Mask, or FF IX.

author: Caio L.

text: I will be getting a New 3DS during Black Friday tomorrow and this will be one of the games that i will download from the eShop as well as a few others and Xenoblade Chronicles.  I love this song so much that i had it as my ringtone.  I still have this game's soundtrack as my favorite of all time due to the fact that there are an abundance of great battle themes, nice unique songs that played a few times during the game, and peaceful town themes.
author: Eric C.

text: only 5 more!!!
author: Bryan Rivas

text: As much as the previous years had some amazing games, 1994 is the first year I would personally call amazing in terms of gaming. The SNES was especially mind blowing and this is when it really separated itself from its competition. Quite a few of my favorite games of all time were released then: Donkey Kong Country (#29), Final Fantasy VI (#12), Super Metroid (#4) and Earthbound (#2). 1994 also gave us games that started popular franchises like Tekken, King of Fighters, Earthworm Jim, Warcraft, System Shock, etc. Still, I had to go with Earthbound here because as you all know by now, it has my favorite soundtrack ever. I'm due for another playthrough soon.
author: SupraDarky

text: Good things it has so many tracks -- you won't run out of Earthbound music to post any time soon
